Boost Productivity with GoInsight. AI Automation Experience the Next Level of Enterprise AI Enterprise Security & Compliance Workflow-Driven AI Native AI Automation AI-Augmented Workforce Explore Now 10 Top Telegram Bot Hosting: Free & Paid Options Isabella Updated on Jul 28, 2025 Filed to: AI Insights Telegram bots are ideal tools for streamlining operations and automating tasks, but they require a constant connection to the Telegram API to function properly. Telegram bot hosting services provide the necessary infrastructure to maintain this connection, ensuring efficient performance. This article will explore what Telegram bot hosting services are, present the top 10 hosting services, and elaborate on how to build a Telegram AI bot for free. Part 1: What Are Telegram Bot Hosting Services? Part 2: 10 Best Telegram Bot Hosting Services Part 3: Tip:How to Build a Telegram Bot Free Part 1. What Are Telegram Bot Hosting Services Bots are essential tools on the Telegram platform, enabling users and business owners to communicate with their audience, receive feedback, promote products, and more. They can quickly transmit texts, videos, audio files, links, and images to multiple users. As user interactions increase, whether for connecting to web services, playing games, making inquiries, or providing feedback, the bot's speed and functionality may be affected. Telegram bot hosting involves storage and optimization services that manage high traffic volumes, ensuring the bot remains responsive and accessible. In addition to traffic management, hosting services offer: Boost reliability : guaranteeing the bot's uptime and reliability Permit scalability : the servers automatically adjust to accommodate peak demand Enhance security : hosting providers enforce robust security measures to protect your bot and user data. Optimize Efficiency : bot hosting improves performance and resource utilization enabling the bot to run smoothly. Are easy to utilize : the hosting platforms have user-friendly interfaces and tools for deploying and managing your bot. 10 Best Telegram Bot Hosting Services Telegram Bot Hosting Best For Render Hosting on multiple servers Replit AI-powered bot hosting Pythonanywhere Hosting Python projects Code Capsules Frontend and backend databases Heroku Backend bot hosting with a traditional architecture AWS Lambda Serverless bot hosting and Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) pricing model Oracle Cloud Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) hosting Hostarmada SSD-powered hosting for fast loading and optimized performance Vercel Serverless function BlueHost Additional WordPress account acquired with the hosting services 1. Render For a versatile platform offering four server types, Render is the perfect option. The software provides web servers, static sites, docker containers, and cron jobs. Leverage the software's flexible configuration to deploy the bot in seconds. Render also has a Git Push feature that helps you update or rewrite your codes for seamless automated redeploys. Key Features Permits automated deploys, which minimize downtime because the application updates with every push. You can run coding language runtimes in managed environments or deploy Docker images and run anything. Enables PostgreSQL database setups capable of retrieving data to a specific point in time Prices Free Hobby account Professional account $19 Organization account $29 A customized pricing account 2. Replit Replit is an Artificial Intelligence (AI) powered hosting for Telegram bots that allows you to develop and deploy bots on the platform. You can build, review, and debug on the same platform. The software offers collaborative options with over 30 million software creators. You can also invite users to review your codes. Key Features utilize AI to debug, autocomplete, and generate codes through conversation The language model has training for over 15 languages Offers prototype templates for popular programming languages like Java and Python Pricing The Starter account is free The Replit Core account charges $15 per month 3. Pythonanywhere Hosting for Telegram bot using the Pythonanywhere platform is simple and effective. Pythonanywhere is ideal for creating and running Python programs. It operates on a cloud-based environment, making it available on any device with a web browser 24/7. The platform is feature-rich and user-friendly for non-tech-savvy users. Key Features Quick bot deployment: no require to configure or maintain a web server Users only require a browser and an internet-enabled device to host a Telegram bot A learning environment full of willing learners and teachers Communicate directly to developers for additional support Pricing Basic account $5/month Web Dev account $12/month Startup $99/month A Customization option from $5 - $500/month 4. Code Capsules If you are looking for an affordable platform with frontend and backend server options, Code Capsules represents perfect solution. You can easily host a Telegram bot on a Backend Capsule due to its user-friendly interface and straightforward setup process. The software also supports an array of languages enriching your options when deliberating on your bot's tech stack. Key Features Integrates with third-parties Offers a cloud computing option Users can leverage the platform's collaborative tools when developing, debugging, or generating codes. Database monitoring and support are available Provides comprehensive data security Pricing Frontend option $2/month Backend option $5/month Data option $15/month 5. Heroku Another cloud-based backend option that offers top-tier features and functions for hosting a Telegram bot is Heroku. The platform as a service (PaaS) software supports several programming languages, from Java, Node. js, Python, Scala, PHP, Clojure, and Go. Heroku offers a free tier but limited runtime. The paid tier has more features and functions. Key Features Offers trusted databases at terabyte scale Scalable dyno choices, including Dyno performance for your high-traffic Telegram bot Ability to work on code with the platform's infrastructure Structures for automated scaling and deployment with minimal downtime. Pricing Eco basic plan $5/month and up Production plan max of $25/month and up Advanced plan $250/month and up Enterprise plan offers custom pricing 6. AWS Lambda The perfect solution for telegram bot hosting and free data management is the AWS Lambda. The platform provides swift, flexible, serverless, and cost-effective bot interactions. Bots operate in two modes. The Pull Mode constantly interacts with Telegram to update data. On the other hand, the Webhook Mode uses an HTTP request to a specified URL to access and process messages from the bot. Key Features Convenient Python API implementation Integration with Telegram bot operational tools Connect to shared file systems. Automatic scaling Link to related databases Pricing A free tier for 1 million requests at 400,000 GB/second a month Pricing plans are chargeable monthly on demand under limited thresholds 7. Oracle Cloud For a cloud computing platform with IaaS and PaaS products, Oracle Cloud is the best option. The platform can host a Telegram bot because of its PaaS product. It also offers a 30-day free Telegram bot hosting period for testing before committing to the platform. However, navigating the Oracle Cloud site requires insight because of the complexity rendered by the services offered by the software developer. Key Features Build and deploy a Telegram bot frontend and UI Host any components on any Node. js accessible over the internet Integrate the bot with your application's monitoring tools Pricing Only pay for resources used 8. Hostarmada Hostarmada represents Solid State Drives (SSD) powered Telegram bot hosting option. SSDs do not require infrastructure. Its technology uses interconnected flash memory chips to store data instead of hard disks. The platform also offers cloud technology. The Hostarmada has high loading speeds and optimizes bot performance. Key Features Daily data backups for extra security Free website migration from Telegram to the host platform Around-the-clock support system for any web hosting-related inquiries Users also obtain free SSL, domain, and optimization Multilayered security firewall for comprehensive data protection Pricing Basic plan $2. 49/month Reseller plan $21/month VPS & Dedicated CPU $29. Vercel Another worthy PaaS contender is the Vercel platform. It is ideal for hosting frontend and static sites. The software's cloud services create it perfect for hosting Telegram bots. It also supports multiple programming languages to develop your bot. The platform's easy-to-utilize interface makes the platform an excellent option for beginners. The platform offers a free Telegram bot hosting option with decent features and functions. Key Features Deploy the Telegram bot directly from the platform or git Provides previews for every push Automated HTTPS is available for all your domains Zero configuration deployment Comprehensive data security Pricing The Hobby plan represents free option The Pro plan starts at $20/month The Enterprise plan offers customizable pricing 10. BlueHost A WordPress-recommended hosting provider with seamless integration worth hosting your Telegram bot is BlueHost. It links with the famous content management site for additional bot management features. The hosting platform's primary feature is high performance. Aside from its impressive fast speeds, the users also obtain 24/7 support from developers. Key Features Automated WordPress account addition Boosted website performance with CloudFlare Server-level caching technology for improved load times Hosting services have SSDs for improved bot performance Pricing The Basic plan starts at $2. 95/month and renews at $11. 95/month Choice Plus plan starts at $5. 99/month Online Store plan starts at $9. 95/month and renews at $26. 99/month The Pro plan starts at $13. 95/month and renews at $28. Tip: How to Build a Telegram Bot Free Creating a Telegram bot using BotFather represents common choice. However, this method often requires coding skills and server configuration, resulting in a rule-based bot. AI , you can build powerful Telegram AI bots in just a few simple steps. AI's visual platform lets you design the bot's logic by connecting nodes, and it handles the underlying execution, meaning you can create bots: Without needing extensive coding knowledge. Without struggling with complex code structures. Without managing a Telegram server. AI Effortlessly automate your Telegram presence, from managing group interactions to deploying AI-powered bots, all through intuitive workflows. Conclusion Telegram bots drive a lot of traffic to your channel and group. The volume of data exchange can slow its operation, create glitches, and interfere with your efficiency. Optimize your bot's performance with Telegram bot hosting. Leverage the best hosting platforms with free and paid options advantageously to create the most out of your bot. Cloud Firewall Blur-speed RDP access powered by NVMe SSDs‚Äîlike working locally, but from anywhere on Earth. 24/7 Live Chat Support Craft cloak-and-dagger VPN tunnels with military-grade encryption and 24/7 guardian-angel support. üöÄ Launch Your Telegram Bot in 8 Easy Steps You don‚Äôt require to be a Linux wizard to obtain your Telegram bot online. Just follow these straightforward steps and you‚Äôll have a fully functional bot up and running on your own VPS in minutes. Set Up Your VPS Log in to your VPS dashboard and choose the resources your bot needs ‚Äî RAM, CPU, storage, and Ubuntu OS. Once deployed, connect using PuTTY or your terminal and update the system: sudo apt-obtain update && sudo apt-obtain upgrade -y 2. Install Required Software Install Python: sudo apt-obtain install python3 python3-pip -y Install Git (if your bot is in a repository): sudo apt-obtain install git -y 3. Clone and Setup Your Bot git clone https://github. com/yourusername/yourbot. git cd yourbot Install its dependencies: pip3 install -r requirements. Configure Your Bot If your bot has a config file, update it with your Telegram Bot Token. obtain the token from @BotFather on Telegram. Run Your Bot Launch your bot script: python3 bot. Keep Your Bot Running 24/7 Install tmux to keep the bot alive even after you disconnect: sudo apt-obtain install tmux -y tmux new -s yourbot python3 bot. py To detach from tmux, press Ctrl+B then D. Optional: Auto-begin bot on reboot Create a systemd service: sudo nano /etc/systemd/system/yourbot. service Paste this: ini [Unit] Description=Your Telegram Bot After=network. target [Service] User=root WorkingDirectory=/path/to/yourbot ExecStart=/usr/bin/python3 /path/to/yourbot/bot. py Restart=always [Install] WantedBy=multi-user. target Then enable and begin it: 7. Monitor and Manage Check logs in real-time: sudo journalctl -u yourbot -f Restart if needed: sudo systemctl restart yourbot 8. Secure Your VPS Set up a firewall: sudo ufw allow OpenSSH sudo ufw enable And remember to regularly update your system. SOURCE 7: https://dev.to/tjtanjin/how-to-host-a-telegram-bot-on-ubuntu-a-step-by-step-guide-4jk3

Introduction Hey there! Have you ever thought about having your own Telegram bot? Well, you‚Äôre in for a treat. In this brief step-by-step guide, we‚Äôll walk through hosting your highly own Telegram bot on Ubuntu. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned developer or just dipping your toes into the tech waters, this is your chance to bring exciting ideas to life on a popular messaging platform! So obtain comfy, and let‚Äôs embark on the journey to unleash the full potential of your digital creations. Prerequisites Before we begin our learning journey, do note that this guide assumes knowledge of the following: Provisioning a VPS Familiarity with SSH Familiarity with linux command line A Ready Telegram Bot Project (if you don‚Äôt, feel free to utilize mine as an example or check out this guide !) We will not be covering the above as they are not the focus of this guide ‚Äî there are plenty of guides out there for them as well! All that said, if you require assist with any of the above, you are more than welcome to reach out for assistance. Server Setup To kickstart your learning journey, you will require to have a VPS (Virtual Private Server) provisioned from cloud providers such as DigitalOcean or OVH. Since we‚Äôre hosting a Telegram Bot, you will require to have a project ready to be hosted as well. If you don‚Äôt, fret not! You can clone and create utilize of the project that I have published here on Github to follow through with the rest of this guide. Once you have your server provisioned, it‚Äôs time to obtain your hands dirty with the actual setup! First, SSH into your server with the following command (replacing 172. 1 with your actual IP address): ssh root@172. 1 Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode You shall be prompted to enter the root password that would were provided by your cloud provider. Upon logging in, run the following commands to update packages: apt-obtain update && apt-obtain upgrade Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode Next, to ensure that we can keep our Telegram Bot running 24/7 later on, we shall be using screen which may be installed with the following command: apt-obtain install screen Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode User Setup While the server setup is completed, it is not a good idea for us to run our python program using the root account. Let us quickly create a new telegrambot user that shall be used to handle the hosting of our Telegram Bot. Run the following command to create this new user: adduser telegrambot Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode For the remaining part of the guide, exit from your root SSH session and login as telegrambot instead (again replacing 172. 1 with the IP address of your VPS): ssh telegrambot@172. 1 Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode Project Setup & Launch Depending on your choice of project, you will require to ensure your project is setup and ready to run. If you are using the project I shared as an example, then the setup for it was clearly written in the README. Once the project setup is complete, initialize a new screen session with the following command (this is crucial if you desire your bot to be running 24/7): screen Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode Hit enter to continue and in this new screen, begin your telegram bot with with the following command (assuming you are using a Python project): python3 main. py Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode Detach from the screen by hitting CTRL + A + D on your keyboard. create sure to hit all 3 at once because just hitting CTRL + D alone will terminate your screen instead. To view the list of screens, you may utilize the following command: screen -ls Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode To reattach to the screen, simply utilize the command: screen -r Enter fullscreen mode Exit fullscreen mode On a side note, screen (or tmux if you prefer so) has a wide variety of uses beyond just the one shown in this guide. They may be used to run time consuming processes such as training machine learning models or even hosting Minecraft servers ! Conclusion With that said, your Telegram Bot should now be running 24/7! The guide has made several assumptions about the choice of your projects so depending on your setup (e. using JavaScript instead), some commands may be slightly different. As an additional challenge, you might consider implementing liveness monitoring for your Telegram bot ! It's a step beyond the basics but not significantly more complex - and if you require someone to bounce ideas with, I'm more than happy to do so here or in the comments. Thank you for reading and hope you enjoyed this short walkthrough! Create template Templates let you quickly answer FAQs or store snippets for re-utilize. Submit Preview Dismiss Are you sure you desire to hide this comment? It will become hidden in your post, but will still be visible via the comment's permalink.
